basic.description: Broad overview of basic laws of gravitation, radiation, and relativity: history and evolution of modern astronomy; ground and space-based astronomy; the physics and evolution of stars; the milky way; galaxies in the universe; and cosmology. This course also uses the on-campus observatory at an introductory level.
basic.subject: PHYS
basic.title: Introduction to Astrophysics

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites    (PHYS104 or PHYS106) and (MATH120 or MATH121 or MATH122) or permission of the Department.
